title.value: Health satisfaction outcome from integrated autonomous mobile clinics
title.justification: The title is explicitly provided at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Health satisfaction outcome from integrated autonomous mobile clinics

extractions.description: This study investigates the effectiveness of Autonomous Mobile Clinics (AMCs) in improving health satisfaction outcomes by integrating care delivery systems. It highlights the potential of AMCs in enhancing access to healthcare, particularly for disadvantaged groups, through technologies like autonomous driving and telemedicine.

type.justification: The study involves observational data collection and analysis of patient satisfaction with the use of Autonomous Mobile Clinics, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: The study was designed to be a Retrospective Observational design from the existing patients from UFH Hospitals and Clinics (Beijing, Shanghai, Qingdao, Guangzhou, Shenzhen).

name.justification: The paper primarily focuses on the application of AI within the health sector using Autonomous Mobile Clinics.
name.quote: Keywords Digital health, Integrated care, Autonomous driving, AI for health

name.justification: The focus on enhancing healthcare delivery using digital technologies like telemedicine places the research in the Digital Health subfield.
name.quote: Keywords Digital health, Integrated care, Autonomous driving, AI for health

name.justification: The research heavily emphasizes the role of telemedicine in the operation of AMCs.
name.quote: Telemedicine: network connectivity is key to guaranteeing the Quality-of-Service (QoS) of telemedicine applications.
